Colin G. Calloway is a professor of history and Samson Occum Professor of Native American Studies at Dartmouth College. He served for two years as associate director of and editor at the D'Arcy McNickle Center for the History of the American Indian at the Newberry Library in Chicago and taught for seven years at the University of Wyoming. Professor Calloway has written many books on Native American history, including
The Scratch of a Pen: 1763 and the Transformation of North America
One Vast Winter Count: The Native American West Before Lewis and Clark
(2003); and two books for the Bedford Series in History and Culture:
Our Hearts Fell to the Ground: Plains Indians Views of How the West Was Lost
The World Turned Upside Down: Indian Voices from Early America
